args:
During the egg hunt, the party happens upon
a kindly dragon called Simurgh. However, for
reasons unknown, the dragon has lost herself
and is off on a rampage. The party endeavors
to try and calm her down.
With Fleur's guidance, the prince and his friends\nhave reached the inner part of the forest before\nany of the other egg hunt participants.
All right, team, let's make the most\nof this head start!
That map of yours really helped\nus out, Fleur.
Heh, 'course it did! Now, let's find us\nsome eggs.

Aaaaaand...TIME! Nice try, Sylas,
but you'll have to do more than 
pick herbs if you wanna beat
ME in a race. Nya ha ha!
*pant* *pant* Perhaps you should try\nit some time, if you think it's so easy.
Wow, no tears? You really have grown up!
Would you stop bringing—wait, surely\nthat isn't—
What took you guys so long?
Okay, how the HECK did you get here\nso fast? I'm calling shenanigans.
This is just what happens when I decide\nto take things seriously. Ha ha!
Overconfidence is NOT a good look\nfor you, bro.
Maybe around here...?\nOoo, what a colorful mushroom!
Is that the tickle of inspiration I feel?\nLet's take a closer look...
You there, stop! Stay clear of\nthat fungus; it's a palysium.

If disturbed, they release a cloud of
poisonous spores that make one's
hands and feet go numb, while your
body is consumed from the inside out.

Well gee, thanks for sparing me from that!
Though now that I'm looking, there seem
to be an awful lot of those same shrooms
around here.
Yes, the palysium grows plentifully in\nthis area. Not exactly an ideal place\nto be rummaging for hidden eggs...
Hmm, yeah. We all wanna win,\nbut not THAT badly. Let's go\nsearch somewhere else.
SKREEE! My egg! My precious egg!\nOh, my baby... Where did you go?!
It sounded like it came from above.
Look at those wings—all those COLORS!\nIs that...Simurgh?
My mother told me about a kind,\nrainbow-winged dragon living in\nthis forest.
SKREEE! Where is it?\nWHERE IS MY EGG?!
She's definitely colorful, but I don't\nthink she's feelin' too kind!
That tremor just unsettled the\nspores—everyone run, NOW!
This cloud is too thick to see through...\nWe'll all be separated at this rate!
Everybody, run to the northern part\nof the forest! We'll regroup there!
Later, along a rugged path in the eastern wood...
We all got separated... \nYou think Luca and the others are okay?
{player_name} is strong,\nand Luca always comes\nthrough when he needs to.
So don't worry about them. Let's just\nget ourselves over to the meeting place.
Meanwhile, atop a knoll\nin the northern wood...
Is that you, Luca? Why are you\nmoving so—wait... You inhaled\nthe palysium spores, didn't you?
Didn't stop me from beating you here\nthough, did it? *cough*
Hold on. I'll mix you an antidote\nwith the herbs I have on hand.
I thought you were all about\naromatics—you can cook up\nantidotes and stuff too?

Many plants commonly used in aromatics
also have medicinal qualities. As luck
would have it, I've actually been studying
detoxicants of late.
Heh, wow. Hard to believe you're the\nsame guy who used to cry all the time.\nYa couldn't even climb trees, man!
As I've told Laranoa, let us leave\nthe past in the PAST.
Easy, easy. Here—can ya forgive\nme now?
Nostalgic, ain't it? This one's\na ＂mustardbomb＂—a real\ntearjerker, heh heh.
Remember when we were kids? Me and\nLaranoa would gather up the ingredients,\nand you'd put 'em all together.
＂Sneezebombs,＂ ＂gigglebombs＂... You two\nhad me up to all sorts of trouble. Heh.

Good gravy, is that a smile?!
Someone call a doctor!
Seriously man, I thought that
scowl was permanent.
We all have a burden to bear. \nEspecially...
Along a trail in the western woods...
La la laaaa, heading to the north!\nHum de dum de dooo...
Thanks for the assist, Laranoa.\nI would've been wandering for\nhours if you hadn't found me.
I probably shouldn't be helping out \nmy rivals, but hey, it's not like you're\ngonna win anyway! Nya ha ha!
That reminds me: weren't you saying\nyou wanted Luca and Sarisse to be\nyour...lackeys, was it?
Yup, as my reward for winning\nthe egg hunt.
But Luca already turned you down once.\nWhy are you so set on them?

They're both very dear friends of
mine; I could never replace them.
And beyond that, I think they're
both happy at the Halidom.
A straight-shooter, huh? I respect that.\nSo here's a straight answer.
I love them too. They're the best friends\nI've ever had, and I want them by my\nside as I start my new life as chief.
I mean, you're the leader of\na whole castle, right?
It's pretty tough, ain't it? Everyone relies\non you for everything, and you can't ever\nshow weakness.

I'm the next chief; the leader of the whole
village. People are gonna expect the world
of me, and that can be a lot for one person
to bear, you know?
I just think it'd all be a little easier if\nI had my best friends there with me,\ngoofin' around and keeping me grounded.
Beyond that, though, the Empire's\nbeen creeping pretty close to my\nvillage lately.
Yeah. I think they might invade,\njust like they did at Myriage Lake.
And if that happens, having folks around\nwho've gone toe-to-toe with the enemy\nwould be a massive help.
What am I saying? With Luca and Sarisse\nfighting with us, we can't lose!
I see. Is the village faring all right\nat the moment?
Sure; the Empire hasn't technically\nencroached yet, so everything's\nstill peachy.
That's good. But I'm still worried\nabout YOU, Laranoa.
You like to play down your problems,\nbut I can sense the tension stewing\nunder your skin.
I'm okay. That's what leaders do, right?\nSwallow all their pain and sadness and\nsay ＂I'm okay＂?
The village's future is up to me. All I can\ndo is be encouraging, reliable, and try my\nbest to hang in there.
That said, if I had some friends\nwith me... Well, I think I could\ndo just a little bit more.
Laranoa... You've no idea how\nwell I understand that feeling.

But I'm sorry, I'd still prefer Sarisse and 
Luca stay with me at the Halidom. I know
that's not what you want, but perhaps I
could offer my own friendship instead.

We're in similar positions as leaders, so
I imagine we might have plenty of shared
worries. We could consult with each other,
bare our fears, share successes...
And if the Empire ever comes near your\nvillage, I'll be there to fight them off.\nThat's a promise.
...Thank you. That means a ton, really.\nBut can I actually rely on you for all that?

Similar positions or not, you're still human
and I'm still sylvan. Our lives are different.
And that means our perspectives are
fundamentally different too.

Heck, it's hard to even find two sylvans
that share the same opinion. Can I really
count on someone so far removed from
my culture to understand me?
I've had no problem coexisting with\nsylvans up to now; just ask Luca and\nSarisse. I really think—
Hold up. *sniff* Is that...? *sniff* *sniff*\nIt IS! I smell one of Sylas's aromatics!
It's coming from the north; he might\nbe with the others. C'mon!
Luca! And Sarisse and Fleur, too!
Guess we have Sylas's aromatics to\nthank for bringing us all back together.\nOr was it just his B.O.? Ha ha!
Personally, I'd have been lost\nwithout Laranoa.
She always did have a great nose. \nGood looks, Laranoa.
Heh heh, feel free to keep the\ncompliments coming!
Luca, the antidote has run its course, yes?\nThen my care for you has as well. I'll be\nreturning to—
There's a dragon over there attacking\neverything in sight!
That seems likely.\nCome on, let's hurry and stop her!
